content.question: In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, two identical blocks, Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, are sliding to the right at speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> and have a total kinetic energy of <math alttext="K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. In Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the two blocks are sliding in opposite directions with speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> and a total kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is true of <math alttext="K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> compared to <math alttext="K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is less than <math alttext="K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is equal to <math alttext="K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is greater than <math alttext="K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>.

The relationship between <math alttext="K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> cannot be determined without knowing the masses of the blocks.

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is equal to <math alttext="K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
